titleStmt.title: Hermann Waltershausen
born Göttingen, Oct 12, 1882; died Munich, Aug 13, 1954

div.p: German composer, who worked at the Akademie der Tonkunst in Munich, 1920-21 as professor and assistant director, 1922-32 as joint director with Siegmund von Hausegger. He also organized the Münchener Tonkünstlerverein. He was active during and after the Nazi era.
Waltershausen's wife, Philippina, wrote a letter to Schenker in 1931 (OJ 15/9; see Federhofer, pp. 288-9, fn 10), regarding words Schenker had written about Thomas Mann.
